The two other bartenders were milling around but did not help her. So the hubs had to endure some random, potentially contagious woman's behind rubbing against his left leg while she took orders from other groups of people. He was highly grumpy after being mauled and ignored.

In reality, this joint rates about a 2.5 however I rounded up to a three based on the fact that there was 1 dish which was truly outstanding. However, given our experience, we are not likely to return. 3 starred review.
The pork belly... sex on a plate. The duck breast - this is a family show!  Every piece of sushi, every roll, every piece of sashimi was incredible. Highly recommended!!

What can I saw but wow!  I was recently in Miami Southbeach and visited SushiSamba. Well my friend knew many of the bartenders from being a regular patron. So we definitely got good service! 
Well visiting Las Vegas 3 weeks later I decided to look for a local SushiSamba. Using yelp I found there to be a SushiSamba in Venetian on the strip. I checked their website to verify they were open and found out they had a reverse (late) happy hour starting at 11pm till close.
So my friend and I took a cab from Hardrock hotel (probably last time there, thats a whole different story) to Venetian hotel. On arrival I saw the bar was placed in front where there were a few seats available. So we sat down towards the end of the bar and asked if we could eat dinner at the bar. The bartender Mari (Maria)  gave us some menus and we asked for the happyhour menu which had just started. I asked about some of the items on the menu and she was very friendly and informational. My friend was actually not feeling good and she gave him some tonic water and small amount of bitters to help ease his stomach. (which actually helped later on)
She ended up getting real busy at the bar but no matter how busy she got she always made sure we got what we needed in a timely manner. She balanced about 10-15 bar patrons orders drink and food wise along with still making drinking for all the waiters ordering drinks for their patrons. I felt she was really efficient and still friendly in demeanor always smiling! I find good freindly custommer service is hard to come by now a days. Kristina the floor manager checked in with us and made sure we were doing ok and that all our needs were meet. Another great show of good customer service. When the managers come up and check in with their patrons I feel they are actually taking interest and want to make sure all your needs are being meet!
We had a really good night there so much we decided to go back the following night to see if we could have another good successful night again. Well our expectations were exceeded again. Mari was working again and thanked us for returning and even went out her way to have us try a few things on the menu we didn't even order to ask our opinion. She even made drinks to our specific needs (my friend didn't want that much sugar in his drink) She made it to meet his needs and turned out to still be a decent drink. Mari's good customer service was the best during my stay in Vegas and I was there july 4-9. She far exceeded my expectations and went above and beyond! The floor manager Kristina also sat down with us to talk about customer service and again making sure everything meet our expectations.  I have to recommend SushiSamba, the bartender Mari (Maria) and the floor manager Kristina. 5 stars and i would tell anyone heading to visit to make it a stop for sushi or tapas.

One of the best decorated restaurants I've been to.
The sushi is outstanding.
They put a very unique spin on their ceviches.
I highly recommend the robata.
Especially the Hamachi Kama, their version of Yellowtail collar.
I don't say this about many restaurants, but you have to see thier restrooms while you are there also.
I wasn't sure about the fusion, but mind blown! We left it to our waiter to decide our courses and all 6 of us loved everything. They know the menu and my advice is to leave it to them. Amazing.

(1 star review) I'd probably have given this restaurant a better review if they had honored our reservation. We were a party of 6, who waited nearly an hour and finally left in disgust. The story seemed to be that people were taking a long time to leave. That happens in every good restaurant in the world, and managers learn to allow for it. They learn how to gently encourage people to leave. If the wait is egregious, they tell you what's up, maybe comp you a drink. What they don't do is keep you standing outside, with no information, like you were a walk-in. Treating customers like cattle is a sure way to make sure that they write bad reviews on Yelp and tell their friends not to go there. Sushi Samba simply sucks.

(3 star review) UPDATE: You can tell a lot about a restaurant by the way they handle things that go wrong. Like the review above. I got a message the next day from their Regional Director of Operations apologizing profusely and offering to make things right. I had already left Vegas, so it was too late.  But I will give Sushi Samba another try next time I go back. And if it's a great experience I'll be happy to update this review again. Meanwhile, three stars for now.

(5 star review) SECOND UPDATE: I finally had a chance to go back to Sushisamba with some colleagues for another try. Michael, the regional director of operations, was beyond gracious and attentive. We were seated immediately. At the server's recommendation, we ordered a sampler meal, allowing the chef to put together a parade of astonishing items. The food was sublime. The combination of Japanese and South American sensibilities makes for dishes that are memorable, original and flavorful. They have a large selection of Japanese whiskeys which we sampled, much to all of our delight. They recommended an excellent sake. And the food just kept coming and coming. I think the highlight of the panoply was  the wagyu beef slices cooked at the table on a 600° hot rock. Yeah, it was expensive. But well worth it. At this point, I would happily recommend Sushisamba to anyone looking for an adventurous and delicious dining experience in Las Vegas.

This place ROCKS! Located at the Palazzo, the place meets Vegas expectations- EXTREME.  The decor was fancy, the waitresses/hostess- HOT. Here is what i ordered:

Miso Encrusted Sea-bass robata; Duck robata; Hamachi jalapeno and lemon grass; Tuna Tataki; Hamachi ceviche

     Of Everything, the Sea-bass was THE BEST- Hands down. Probably the best I've ever had.  The waiter happened to recommend the sea-bass over the scallops for taste & portion size. Good call on his part, showing me that the staff is educated and willing to make suggestions.  The Hamachi and lemon grass was great.  Tuna Tataki- was OK, not great, not bad, The Hamachi Ceviche was tasty as well. 
     Friends suggested the Peruvian Plate- enough for two, but i was too interested in the menu selection to choose otherwise. He DID goto SushiSamba a bit after me, and ordered it again, so it must be worthwhile.
     Overall it was a GREAT dining experience. I will DEFINITELY be back for more. I will probably make this a staple for dining everytime i head back to Las Vegas.

OMG!  I was super surprised how awesome this place was.  I was expecting some hyped up place since it was Vegas.  I was a bit skeptical since it is Japanese/Peruvian fusion.  Since it was my first time there, I didn't know what to order.  But with some tips of my friends who recommended the place, we opted for the waitress to make a menu for us.  She asked how much we wanted to spend.  I decided to go all out since it was my fiance's birthday weekend and said we wanted to spend a $100 per person.  I forgot what they brought out to us, but everything was so delicious.  Whenever I think of going to Vegas again, I definitely want to come back.  The service was great.  And we had about 6 people with us, so they just ordered off the menu.  If you don't like what they have on the menu, just have them make one for you.  They ask if you like raw fish or if your prefer cooked.  We weren't disappointed at all.

I love this place! We made reservation on OpenTable, arrived early but got a table in 5 mins. The location is great and the atmosphere was relaxing and laid back. The service was great too.

We had their recommended sea bass skewer, the best sea bass I've ever had! The eggplant robata, Peruvian Corn at the side were both great as well. They were very flavorful and I think people with different tastes would be happy with it.

We also tried their Lima sushi roll, it was good, not surprising though. The signature Wagyu Beef Gyoza. It was made with butter on the bottom, and even for me who doesn't really like butter, I like that one.

In terms of dessert, we had the chocolate sata andagi, a vanilla ice bream scoop with sugar-ry and chocolate rice ball.

The 4 star rating Sushisamba Las Vegas is currently sporting is spot on.  For me this Sushisamba location is more of a 4 and a 1/2.  I have been to the Sushisamba location in South Beach Miami and this one at the Palazzo was equally as good.  I really love the mix of ceviche and sushi that is on the menu at Sushisamba.  My girlfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our meal here and it was the start of a perfect evening.  We ordered the tuna ceviche, some spicy tuna sushi, salmon with avocado sushi and a few other items.  The service at Sushisamba was exceptional and the wait staff was very present at an appropriate level.  The headline for Sushisamba if I was publishing a review would be pretty simple and would read "Great sushi and ceviche!".  Other things of note include that the interior is little loud and the seating a little tight.  If you are going here for a quiet meal you likely wont be happy unless you come in off peak.  The decor and design of the interior is cool, trendy and hip. My only dig on my visit would be I ordered a caipirinha and it tasted like it was made with sour mix (not great).  Other than that, it was a near perfect experience and I would go back anytime.  Thanks Sushisamba!

Tanice is the most knowledgeable waitress I have ever met!  She has an encyclopedic knowledge of the menu and attentive customer service!  Tanice food recommendations were excellent.  I highly recommend Sushi Samba for people visiting Vegas, especially the Ramen bowl and Steak meat platter - delicious.

Edible. The type of place that should anybody find you eating at, you would try to quickly make up an excuse for why you "just needed to grab a quick bite" and then quickly disparage it and say you're eating there in more of an ironic fashion than anything else. The "sushi chefs" here learned not from a sushi master, but rather in a 30 minute how-to session from a 43-year-old named Brent whose true passion is "riding dirty on my quads."

On my most recent visit to the fabulous Las Vegas, the GF and I went on a Sushi hunt. We found this place and decided to check it out. 

The atmosphere was very live and comfortable. The decor is really interesting and beautiful. Our waiter was very friendly and informative of the food. My gf ordered some wontons in a squash sauce and some sushi. I don't really care for sushi, so I ordered the 3 meat plate (Flank Steak, Sirloin, and Linguica) the food was amazing! The plate also came with some dipping sauces that I didn't care too much about. The beef was super tender and flavorful. The place is a bit pricey for the amount of food you get, but it is Vegas.

Sushi Samba puts an excellent spin on traditional sushi.  The fusion of Japanese and South American flavors are a perfect combination.  Since I like my food on the spicy side, I found that Sushi Samba adds that flare to usually very neutral sushi.  

The one dish I found to be my favorite of the visit was the Hamachi (Yellowtail) Sashimi Tiradito.  Hamachi is always a great choice for its oil content, but along with the spicy/tangy sauce it is served on is a more than suitable replacement for shoyu.  I also tried the Yamato Roll, which is sushi with maguro and  foie gras, a great and unique flavor.  One disappointment I found was the Kobe Beef Sushi.  I would rather have had otoro.  One last recommendation, don't order collard greens at a sushi place.  It was decent although it was no southern style collard greens that I prefer.  

I will definitely go back to Sushi Samba the next time I am in Vegas.  There are so many things on the menu that I still want to try!

I ate at this location recently and the one in Chicago (in 2011)...I must say the Chicago location was much better. Our group was craving sushi so we stick to ordering mostly Japanese food instead of the Brazilian or Peruvian dishes.

Some of the dishes I remembered ordering were Samba Strip (TERRIBLE!!!), Yamato, BoBo Brazil, extra crunchy salmon skin hand roll, Samba Sashimi, Uni, yellowtail ceviche tacos and some other stuff. The two best dishes were the Yamato roll with foie gras and the uni (very fresh). Everything else was so-so with the biggest disappointment was the Samba Strip roll. 

Overall nothing was memorable. I was quite disappointed given my last experience in Chicago was so mouthwatering I've been waiting to go to Vegas to try again.

Wow, wow, and WOW! A must try if you are in Vegas. I was a bit hesitant to try this place after reading it was a sushi/Peruvian/Brazillian Fusion Restaurant but I am glad I did! Their service was amazing. We were seated promptly, and given an option to order off the menu or have the chef make a tasting menu to our liking. I really loved that option, but was hesitant since this was an entirely new cuisine for me. This place is tapas style so I suggest 3-4 dishes to share between two people. Rock Shrimp are a must! Out of this world. Perfectly fried shrimp covered in spicy mayo and another sweet type sauce. Served piping hot and fresh! We also got the Wagyu Beef Gyoza. They were again out of this world! We also got the roll with mozzarella salmon and onion strings (can't remember name) but it was delicious. I could've eaten the entire thing.

Once you get past the crowds in the Canal Shops, Samba Sushi is a real find.  Varied menu combining Asian and South American cultures.  We had a shrimp teriyaki roll, an eel roll and a dragon rainbow roll.  Also got the teriyaki chicken skewers with their speciality corn.  Everything was delicious.  No wait time, service was fast, efficient without feeling rushed.  Clean, not terribly loud and Drago was a great waiter.  Prices were OK for Vegas considering that I come from the era of free drinks, shrimp bars along the casino walls and all you can eat buffets.

We had our joint birthday dinner here with some friends in Vegas and we all thoroughly enjoyed our visit. SUSHISAMBA offers a cool blend of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian cuisine. The sushi rolls/pieces were good, but I have to say, the cooked dishes were what really stole the show. The pork belly, miso glazed sea bass, wagyu beef gyoza, rock shrimp tempura, duck breast, Peruvian corn, etc., were fantastic. Our server was great about offering solid recommendations and he ensured that the portions were large enough for each of us to have a taste (we ordered a lot of tapas-style small plates and some large plates).

At the end of our meal, our server brought the birthday boy and me a cake lollipop on a "Happy Birthday" decorated plate, which was a nice surprise and quite delish. He's not big on chocolate but he ate it anyway. Bummer for me because I could have easily eaten his also. We left feeling satisfied and we really enjoyed our selections. 

This is a great place to kick back and enjoy a nice dinner with a date or with some friends. We will revisit when we return to Sin City!

My wife and I really liked Sushi Samba and their fushion menu.  We were running late for a show and couldn't wait to be seated in the main restaurant so we sat at the bar at the edge of the restaurant and the mall area as soon as something opened up.  Lara S was our main waitress plus another girl and she was very friendly and helpful in selecting our drinks and menu items.  My wife and I are big St. Germaine liquor fans and we loved the "Chu-Cumber" drink.  Also thought the Tempura green bean appetizer with truffle aioli sauce was yummie.  We had a sampling of sushi and Pacific, El topo, and spicy tuna rolls and all was very good.

Updating due to the fact that I revisited Sushi samba and got much better treatment. AND the salt and pepper calamari is TO.DIE.FOR. And the cocktails...oh the cocktails.

So yay, SushiSamba for stepping up your game. You are now back on my "must recommend" list.

We ate at the bar waiting to leave for the airport. Would definitely come back for a more thorough meal from my first experience. 

Ordering a la carte from the sushi menu everything was very fresh. I ordered the chef's choice sashimi and sushi sampler and had a good array of their options and was not disappointed. 

Great interior decorated with japanese samurai paintings and bright orange themes. Architecture was very modern but with multiple layers of texture and lines. 

Haven't had a lot of sushi in Vegas but can happily recommend this as a good option.

A group of friends and I ordered from the Chef's menu, where you tell the waiter your likes and dislikes so that the chef can create a dish suitable and substantial to your likings. We decided for the 60-80 dollars a person menu.. 
So after purchasing $100 dollars a head for dinner, I've decided that the only great dish they had was the Kobe beef taco; which wasn't even for us. It was for the birthday girl. I should've said I don't eat fish.

At about midnight, we rallied to head back out into the Vegas night. The boys lured us with promise of 20-pc McNuggets (yeah.... we're that type of girls :P).... luckily, we ended up at Sushi Samba instead. The restaurant calls itself a fusion of Japanese-Brazilian-Peruvian. It definitely is fusion - but done very well. They recommend to order dishes to share and our waitress was really nice in making sure the servings matched the number of people in our group. 

What stands out in memory? The salt and pepper squid. Berkshire Pork Belly ramen (the bf had to be reminded to play nice and share ;) Crispy taquitos!!!!! Chilean sea bass (how did they get that on a skewer and yet still tastes so tender?!). BoBo Brazil samba roll. 

The only reason I'm giving a 3 star review instead of 4 is that the servings are rather small for the price. We did all leave super full though. And I rather wish someone had ordered the ceviche - I bet it's delicious!

This place is HOT! Soooo crowded during the dinner rush hours. The Salt & Pepper Squid was out of this wold. If you have a large group probably better to have a late dinner here. I definitely recommend this restaurant especially if you like being around a lot of hot people.

They got rid of the best roll on the menu. The one I recently posted the foie gras roll with gold flakes ! I came In during lunch and had the Omakase this time with my coworkers. It seems as though the quality of the fish has gone down. The yellowtail carpaccio had way too much Yuzu sauce. If you have quality sashimi it is not necessary to drench it in sauce. Salmon carpaccio was mediocre. Overall not satisfied def won't be a spot to frequent anymore
Above my expectation with innovative and tasty dishes. Highly recommended even though it's a bit pricey

It was quite a nice surprise to have a Japanese and Peruvian  place in our hotel!   Service was excellent, nice ambiance and the food was all so fresh and tasty. The cocktails were strong and delicious.  Waiter was a bit annoying at times but the crowd I was with was a little boisterous too and poor guy really worked hard for his tip that night. I will definitely be back to try more of the menu.

Best steak in Vegas for the price. You get a great cut of meat and always paired with interesting sides and sauces.  The rest of the menu is inspired and you truly cannot choose wrong. The Chilean sea bass is one of the greatest entrees I have ever had.  The service was impeccable and extremely knowledgable about the nuances of the menu offerings. Great ambiance for small tables and large groups alike.

Absolutely terrific. We did the tasting menu with the A5 Wagyu beef, cooked at the table on a hot stone. Terrific dish.

The sashimi with the tasting menu was great, including tuna, salmon, and yellowtail.

That day, one of the specials with the tasting menu was needlefish sushi, a bit unusual taste but quite good.

We also had oversized Peruvian corn kernels with the seabass on a stick, incredibly great dish.

The sushi rolls that came with the tasting menu were great, but I prefer simpler, so these weren't the highlight, but still excellent.

The mochi for dessert was very good, as was the banana cake that we tried.

Great unfiltered cold sake selection, we tried two different kinds.

Very good service, we were slightly late arriving and it was no problem for us to be accommodated.

The best sushi I have ever had....hands down. You can't go wrong with any of the rolls but my favorite was "El Topo." The blue point oysters were outstanding as well.  The service was excellent. Can't wait to go back!

I absolutely loved eating here. The atmosphere is great, cool decoration. The service was fantastic and our server was very friendly. I would list off everything we ordered, but there were five of us and I couldn't remember the names of half the things we ordered, let alone all the desserts (we ordered 3 sampler platters for dessert, so I'll just stick to a few. My father ordered one of the duck dishes, I don't remember which one since I didn't place the order, but it was fantastic. The duck was perfectly cooked and the sauce was a perfect complement to the natural flavors of the duck. The two rolls we ordered were the Samba Strip and the Bobo Brazil. The Bobo brazil was absolutely phenomenal. The seared kobe inside was of great quality and worked very well with all of the other ingredients. The Samba Strip was very different for me, as I had never had a roll with Lobster and was a little unsure, but I'm glad we went with it! I loved the way the peanut curry worked with the mango and the texture of the lobster. The most memorable part of the night, by far, was ordering the dessert. My girlfriend is from Brazil and one of her absolute favorite things is Brigadeiro. She was ecstatic to see it on the dessert menu in one of the dishes, because it is difficult to find a place that makes Brigadeiro (good or not aside, there just aren't many places that have it), especially where we live (AZ). She asked our server if she could just get a small plate of Brigadeiro by itself for dessert, and the server he would have to check with the chef. Here, though, they went a little above and beyond for me. Despite the Brigadeiro being listed only as an ingredient in a dish, the chef said that they would make a plate by itself, just for us. However, the chef wanted to inform us that it was not traditional brigadeiro, and even prepared a small sample for us to try before ordering a plate so that we wouldn't be disappointed if we were hoping for the traditional stuff. I can't find fault with service like that.

On a side-note, they have a dish that is cooked on a hot stone and comes out sizzling on that hot stone. I have no idea what it was called, but it was ordered repeatedly by other tables and smelled absolutely phenomenal. I would go back just to sit at the bar and be able to smell that dish being brought out to other tables.

SUSHISAMBA is always on my itinerary when I come out here for my annual birthday celebration/vacation. I came here two days ago after my wonderful massage, all excited, hungry, and ready to throw down on some food, so I was glad I made it just in time for the happy hour. To my surprise, service was kind of amiss: my order initially came out wrong, my caipirinha was off and had to be adjusted, the salmon in my salmon avocado roll was a little dark, and the mosquitoes flying around me and my food drove me nuts! The only saving grace was the pork belly and the plantains, which were excellent (the mosquitoes thought so too).

I really hope SUSHISAMBA isn't slacking off on what made them my fave in the first place :/ Sushi don't fail me now...

I wasn't entirely impressed but my boyfriend and his cousins kept raving about this place and how good it was so I decided to try it.  I ended up having the pork ramen which to me the broth was pretty bland.  For $18 i expect something a bit more spectacular but it wasn't...the pork was pretty good though!  My boyfriend let me try his kobe beef that was in his bento box and that was okay too.  We ordered a side of fries which never came -booooo!!!  Maybe the next time I'm in town, I'll give it another try and hopefully it will be better but this time it was just "A-OK"

We stopped by early and made a reservation for 1pm for lunch. We were super excited to try the sushi at this place. We showed up 30 min earlier than our reservation and they quickly accommodated us. Anthony was our server and he was fantastic. He helped us with recommendations and we tried all the popular more expensive sushi. Holy moly was it amazing. The sushi is definitely worth the price! Jeremy, which I'm assuming is the manager, was also amazing. He brought us our food which makes you feel special and was also very knowledgeable with the food we ate. Would definitely go back and try again.

Pretty pricey but the service was pretty stellar and the food was spectaular! I really loved the fish tacos. They melt in your mouth! 

The cocktail tree is cute and fun for parties. I thought it was perfectly portioned before a night out on the town.

WOW!  Have been here several times and was never unsatisfied! The food, service, overall atmosphere is simply amazing! This place put so much into the design and the vast menu, even the bath rooms are crazily amazing.
Surf and turf at its finest, the combination between see food, sushi and bbq is great...
And saki menu is amazing! ! !

We ordered the chef's assortment of rolls -- which were, to our pleasant surprise, actual rice paper wraps filled with scallops, tuna, and salmon.

Excellent service, chic feel, and sushi is among the best I've had anywhere on either coast (San Francisco and New York).

Love this place!!! Went there for dinner Saturday night to celebrate my brother-in-law's upcoming wedding. We had a blast here at SushiSamba. The service was great and food was prepped and cooked to perfection. Definitely coming back here!

This was the BEST!!! The food was freakin awesome! Our waitress was really flirty & friendly. We had her create our menu. She made great recommendations & coordinated a great fusion of everything from appetizers & entrees. Everything tasted sooo delicious. I loved the sushi, coconut rice and the mini taco. It took awhile for the food to come but the ambiance was entertaining & it was worth waiting for.

Went here when I was in Vegas for a conference.  The meal I had here had to be one of the best meals I've ever had.  We had a group of 7 and we all got the chef's selection/omikase.  The food just kept on coming and it was all amazing.  There was this one dish that I still dream about.  It was a king crab leg opened up with some kind of butter sauce within the shell.  IT WAS ONE OF THE BEST THINGS I'VE EVER TASTED.  I've been to a lot of high end japanese restaurants and this was the first omikase where I was actually happy and satisfied after.  

Not only was the food great but the service was amazing.  Isaac our server was always on top of trying to keep us happy (and always made sure we had hitachino or sake topped off).  Also, Rannah the manager was amazing as well.  She took to the time throughout our meal to check up on us and make sure we were having an amazing time.  She even offered us recommendations on how to make the most of our time in Vegas.  

We will definitely now be making Sushi Samba a regular occurence at our annual conferences/trips out to vegas

This is the place to go whenever I'm in Vegas. Foods and services are good. Atmosphere is nice. 
I always order churrasco, sushi, and some a la carte menus. Cocktails are good too. If you wanna enjoy both Brazilian bbq and Japanese foods, this is the place to go.

We ate here for lunch. Excellent fusion cuisine. I would highly recommend the chicken teriyaki. Sushi and ramen was good. Price was a bit high for serving size. Very good wait staff; pleasing personality and quick service.

Super fresh fish.  Had the Sake / hamachi / hotate  nigiri.  All of it was really good.  Had the Neo Tokyo roll, super good too.  My faves were still probably the Nigiri.  Pricey.  Nigiri comes in singles...   but so good.  Great service, waiter kept coming back to ask if I needed anything.

This place was lame.  Everything is so expensive for some tiny flavor-less morsels of food.  Definitely do not come here if you are looking for dinner.  This "ambience" is like a night club, it was loud (noise and visually) cramped and stuffy.  Even if you like that stuff, being in the Palazzo it was so out of place.  It was so cramped that I saw a group of women eating their tapas plate on off the couch, how unsatisfying.  Some people say that this is some kind of fine dining place; the problem is the food was nasty and the menu didn't even make sense (Do you want some fried plantains with that Sashimi?  Uhh, No.) Did I say that it was also way overpriced?  They charged me $40 for just one sushi roll.  I guess somebody has to pay for the vintage looking ripped fish net stockings the waitresses were wearing.  
If you are a mega bro, going to do some people watching, totally come here bra.   If you are looking for sushi, leave Las Vegas immediately.
Made reservations but was a little late. They were still very accommodating and we were seated right away. Sea bass skewers were delicious. Definitely would recommend trying this place out.
Lots of different styles that I'm used to but always great to try new things...

You must try the miso glazed sea bass.  OMG! like butta!! Melts in your mouth!! See the pic. The glaze is sweet but not too sweet then BAM! you get that soft, buttery, tender-falling-apart-in-your-mouth sea bass. 
We tried the sampler split amoung a group of ladies, but this IS the dish. This is the most impressive dish here.  The bathrooms are cool too with grafitti art. The food's ok overall, but it seemed like they served both cuisines more than a fusion of the cuisines.

My first sushi dinner! The restaurant had a great atmosphere and EVERYONE was SO nice! My friend Tracy had the miso soup to start. We shared the sashimi tiradito yellowtail jalapeño and lemongrass (great texture and a good sauce), the seabass and miso skewer with peruvian corn (which AMAZINGt!!!!), the crispy taquitos served with spicy aji panca sauce and fresh lime Yellowtail Seviche shiso, avocado, roasted corn miso and the Samba Sushi chef's inspiration. For the two of us, the total for our meal was $100.
Great ambience and amazing food! Every bite bursts with tremendous flavor! Highly recommended place to dine at when visiting in Vegas!!

Their wagyu beef gyozas are AMAZING!! Must-try! The price for sushi and all the other things listed in the menu are extremely high, but what isn't overpriced in Vegas? These gyozas aren't your typical gyozas. The sauce is tangy and sweet and the it's a gyoza you'll never be able to find anywhere else!

Had a great meal here.  The menu is huge and a little overwhelming, but the waiter was very helpful with some suggestions and we wound up doing pretty well. 

The drinks were good, I had mojitos, my group also had a strawberry martini type drink, which I was told was too sweet, and the lemon samurai, which was pretty tasty.

The food was excellent, we had:

Yellowtail Seviche - everyone's favorite, excellent dish, great fish, great seasoning/sauce to it.  I'd have more right now if I could.
Kobe Beef - very good as well, served with mushrooms and sliced super thin.
Beef Tenderloin - which was cooked on the Japanese grill and came out very smoky, it was good, not great.
Rock Shrimp Tempura - also quite tasty, for such a small dish, there was a lot of shrimp packed in.  Nice spicy sauce to it as well.
Sushi Roll - can't remember the name of it, but it was salmon topped with melted mozzarella and little fried onion things.  That was the one dish that was a miss in my book.  The onion overpowered the rest of the dish.  Wasn't bad, but I didn't think all the flavors worked that well together.

The setting is very cool, relaxed, and our waiter was very attentive and helpful.

The waiter was amazing and was super friendly and we could tell he wanted to make our experience amazing so kudos to him! 

The restaurant however was filled with super snooty upity people. That were constantly giving us looks because we maybe didn't fit the look of the usual customer. My friend overheard the woman at the table  next to us complain about my top to her waiter which made our whole table irritated. Then the woman decided to stare at me for most of my meal making me uncomfortable. (I had a purple crop top and jeans on and she acted like I saw naked) smh... 

The Food: ehhh it was just ok. I've been here before and remember it tasting better. It's super expensive for the portions that you get so that's a def a negative. I dunno just overall it was blah.. the waiter saved it!

I know what you are thinking, who in their right mind goes to the middle of the desert and decides that fish would be a good idea?  

Not to say that there isn't just sushi here, the ideas filling the pages of this Japanese/Brazilian/Peruvian fusion menu are pretty extensive.  It's more like three styles you can mix and match from rather than true fusion concocted dishes.  My crew was hungry for fish, so we stuck to primarily the pescatarian options.  Based on what I was able to try, it shook down like this:

The 3's
Spicy tuna & spicy yellowtail were just so so.
Edamame - could have done without the lime
Salmon sashimi -nothing mind blowing, but edible
 

The 4's
Snapper sashimi - a larger cut than the other sashimi, only the fish skin was rough on the tongue.
Eel/Avocado roll - tasty with decent cuts of unagi
Pork belly skewers - good marinated taste, though small in size

 
The 5's
Yellowtail Belly sashimi - Ask for it, it's off the menu, but the chef had some available the day I was there.  Very fresh and the best sashimi at the table by far.
Yellowtail Jalapeno - super hot and spicy, it hurt so good.


Overall, the portions are small and the price can get up there if you order a lot of food, but overall I was pleased with the food and quality of the fish.  I would make my way back again if I am looking for fish in the desert.

Delicious sushi, excellent service and lovely ambiance! Luckily we were staying at The Palazzo, which is where Sushi Samba is located, so it was very convenient for me and my group of girls. We went for dinner and I ordered/tried only a few dishes since I wasn't that hungry:

-MISO SOUP cilantro and tofu
-JAPANESE A5 WAGYU BEEF GYOZA kabocha purée and su-shoyu dipping sauce
-UNI sea urchin (both nigiri & sashimi)

The Japanese A5 was perfect, the flavors all blended so nicely together! The beef inside the savory gyoza was rich and juicy in flavor. The sea urchin was fresh and buttery. The service was outstanding. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating and our server frequently checked on our table. It was my bachelorette weekend and when the server found out, he surprised us with a tower of fruity cocktails. How sweet is that?

My wife and I received the ROYAL TREATMENT at Sushisamba.  The food was incredible, the service was so attentive, it was almost embarrassing.  The first night we ate there it was a quiet Monday night.  It felt like we had 4 servers and two managers attending our every need.  The lobster tempura and chef's special scallops are dishes worth returning to Vegas for.  Allen Holmes, our Holmes boy, was on top of his game.  Our only problem was that the food was so delicious that we probably over-ordered and could not even finish a couple of the dishes.  On our return several days later, Holmes and company treated us like we had been patrons for years, when it was only days before that we first dined there.  The second time around, we did not have a reservation, but Allen sat us down at the long counter style seating, which gave us a big picture view of the whole joint.  The food was equally outstanding.  I am returning with my guys group of ten next weekend.

Wanted to love this place, but ended up very disappointed.   Food was overpriced and not very good and the service was bad.  Waitress seemed rushed and not very attentive.  My cocktail and the lady serving water and taking away our empty plates was the only reason this place got 2 stars.  She was awesome and sweet and the drink was very good.  OH, and did I mention that we found a hard dried booger in my husbands napkin.  SOOOO gross, and ruined my appetite.
Bottom line...would probably meet the girls for drinks here, but not for food.

Maybe it's because I've enjoyed many a meal at the Sushi Samba locations in NYC, and maybe because I was a little hungover from the previous nights festivities, but I was not overly wowed by lunch here with two of my lady loves with whom I was vacationing. 

One thing that is always a priority on vacation is food. It has to be, this is a break from the mundane life I leave behind, so why do I want to eat my standard weekly fare of life in the working world? I love sushi and because of it's nutritious nature figured this would be a great way to replenish all things lost to bottomless cocktails and greasy late night foods. I didn't partake in the consumption of any libations at lunch, but did hear that the mojito was pretty stellar.

I ordered the trio seaweed salad that came beautifully presented on a three trayed dish of hijiki, wakame, and my favorite aka-tosaka. Each were lightly dressed with lemon and sidelined with some tomato caviar. Not terrible for a $11, but not overly substantial either. For lunch I ordered yellowtail jalapeno which was ok if not a little heavy on the jalapeno, and a spicy tuna that was all sorts of bland. I think I would have been happier enjoying these as a happy hour because it seems that the prices are a little easier to swallow for the quality of the food. I didn't order anything complex, and maybe they just let the "easy" stuff slide, but I wasn't terribly enthused enough to want to go back and give it a second shot to see just how good the rest of the menu is according to the higher ratings given.

Service is INCREDIBLE! Our server was really cool. We ordered a tasting menu. This is the way to go. You select your price they take care of the rest. Tanice asked about our food preferences and based on that she created a menu of different courses to suit our taste. The food is delicious but it's the service that will make me come back. Throughout our evening Allen the restaurant manager came by to make sure we were having a great experience.

To start off I was not expecting to be blown away with this place but I WAS!! Everything from this restaurant was beyond my expectations.
Went there for a special treat and oh my... we had one.

First off I would not say the sushi is extraordinary, in fact its standard but I did love the yellow tail scallion there more than I do at most places, but the items on the menu other than sushi is what got me!

First and for most  the drink tower is amazing and unique from the appearance to all the different varieties like the cucumber one, strawberry, grapefruit, and so on...we tried total of 6!!. My favorite was the one with the cucumber and the one with the mint cant recall the actual names due to all the drinks ; ) 

Now on to the MEALSSSSS the ones I loved would have to be the steak tacos, best I had in a really long time and the sauce that they come with has a little kick that makes it all so complete. Another one would have to be the Alaskan king crab leg cut in perfect portions to be grabbed with the chop sticks and topped off with a cream sauce was sooooooooo good!! There was also the miso sea bass if you like the taste of the miso flavor and appreciate sea bass like I do its a must, even though my last bite on the skewer was not as great as the first 3 ; ( and my favorite dish of the whole night would have to be the in shell scallops!!!! I had never seem my scallops served in a shell till I went to this place, they were cooked with perfection and had some sort of pesto butter topping them off. I can literally eat so many and never have enough!! 
One more dish worth mentioning would have to be the tempura shrimp even though I am not a fan of most fried foods this one was good!! And the portion was giant!

As far as the dessert I am usually one to clear out all the plates but this was not the case for me, we got the mochi variety dish but it was too frozen it didn't do the mochi justice, and our other dessert consisted of friend bananas (Which i am not a fan of) and coconut cream and the best coffee ice cream I have ever had! This meal was a fun teat and experience and the staff was amazing! 

Another tip on the side is make reservations, it was PACKED when we got there...

I've been to Sushi Samba in Miami and Chicago (when it was open) and the Las Vegas location didn't disappoint either. 

Loved loved loved the food and is probably one of my all time favorite restaurant chain. 

Tips: get the yellowtail taquitos and the sea bass anticucho. Sushi and meats are great too. 

It's a Japanese, Peruvian, Brazilian fusion restaurant; they excel at all 3. 

Now if only they had a restaurant in LA or San Francisco...

OMG, is it possible to be this good?  3 times there now and 3 times I have been equally impressed.  One thing that has been a constant on all 3 visits has been the great service I received.  Our waiters always their menu's and made fantatsic recommendations.  This time I had the tempura greenbeans with a truffle oil dipping sauce (Delicous!), Berkshire Pork Gyoza and Rock Shrimp Tempura (at the recommend of our server)  Everything was well prepared and efficiently served.  Sushi Samba is now a place that I can truly call home for great Sushi.  As you can tell by my reviews, its safe to say that I am a fan.

Food was delicious. Ordered a bunch of small plates and the miso glazed sea bass . The sea bass was definitely the star , moist flaky and delicious. Would have been a five star review but the service wasn't the best . had too ask for the check three times. Waitress wasnt paying much attention to our section. Wil definitely go back and try something new.

One star for great, tasty, interesting food. One star for great service!!! 
The rest was disappointing Our bill for party of 6. Around $900.00?! It MAY have been worth it if we weren't sitting OUTSIDE the restaurant in the overflow part of the mall??? NO ambience!!! We had reservations!!! This restaurant should be embarrassed to offer this type of seating. In fact, I think our hostess was embarrassed when I balked and questioned if we should stay??? I will never accept seating like that for a bill like that again. It could have been 5 star if I we weren't on a separate island. 

I've heard back from management.  They were apologetic and sent me a generous gift certificate to use on our next visit. Greatly appreciated their efforts to make thing right. Will update after next visit.

Sushi samba is one of my favorite restaurants this location happens to be my least favorite. I've come in here at least a dozen times and every time I come with people of color they sit all color people in the same section away from others. On top of that, fruit flys kept coming to my food.

"The best meal I've ever had in my life": this was uttered by 5 of us at the End of the meal.

Our waiter, Max, gave us a $50-60 prix fix menu, and brought us a sampling of the best: edamame, tempura, meats, sushi, cod, squid, etc. all in all, it was amazing.

The scene is very cool. We didn't want to get hosed by going to a club, so this was the next best thing. Good people watching, good music, and amazing food.

Our waiter gave us a free round of cucumber shots, and was vey personable.

The hostesses were young, and dictate a while for us to be seated, but well worth the wait.

Compared to Vegas buffets this place is expensive and the amount of food you get is not alot...again, compared to what you get in Vegas. But, the quality of the food is really great. Recommend coming here with a large group and eating FAMILY STYLE. This is where you tell them how much you want to spend per person and they bring out food for you to eat and try. We had some of the following:

Shishito Peppers: Excellent, large, flavorful peppers. I usually have them at other places and they are small. These peppers where big and So good!
Japanese Wagyu Beef Goyza - AMAZING. One order is not enough.
Peruvian Corn 
The Tacos - I don't remember the name of them, but get the tacos!
All of the sushi rolls are amazing.

EVERYTHING IN THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!

Found this place through yelp and made a reservation through open table.

Here's what we ordered:

Wagyu gyoza:  pretty good
Samba sushi roll:  very good
Samba sushi (nigiri):  will not order again; sushi rice did not taste good
Tapioca con leche:  excellent dessert; served cold and very refreshing

Ambiance:  Very nice; nightclub vibe

classy. dim. convenient. tons of LCD tvs. great food.

i recommend the 25$ teriyaki chicken. the way sushisamba prepares chicken teriyaki is unlike any restaurant that ive ever been to. i was expecting some cookie cutter skimpy chicken teriyaki. but to my surprise the chicken teriyaki came on top of a pile of purple mash potatoes and tasted AMAZING. the chicken was flavored perfectly and.. it melted in my mouth. moist, juicy, tender, man did i enjoy chewing that day. in combination with the mash potatoes makes for a most savory dish. 

sushi is also a good option here. sushisamba sushi comes lightly wrapped in rice rather than how sushi restaurants ordinarily fill their rolls with rice. i liked that. it accentuated the other ingredients such as kobe beef, caviar etc. we pretty much ordered all the rolls and each one was different from the next. although i cant say i enjoyed the kobe beef one as it was kind of bland. also, i wouldnt recommend the oysters because its quite ordinary.

I didn't dine in the actual seated dining area; I was looking for some sushi as a quick bite with a drink so I was seated at the bar.  The bartendar / server was quick, helpful on explaining the restuarant and menu, and courteous.  The sushi was excellent, and it was a great place to grab something quick to eat that was healthy.  The decor is modern and well done.  It's located back in the shopping area, so you gotta kinda look for it, but it's worth taking the time.
Place was simple amazing. Sushi was fresh and drinks were amazing. The service for being a busy holiday weekend was fast and attentive. Missing the sushi and drinks!!!
Ok so I am not easily impressed especially when there is a price tag to go along with it but.... It was awesome. I'm impressed that I was actually impressed.

Rounding out my three night kobe adventure was sushi samba.  This place was pretty darn cool. I give them 4 stars for the kobe and 3 for the rest.  The sushi was very good, but not "las vegas" good.  There are far better places if you just want sushi.  But this place is different, offering a spin of Brazillian flare on the Japanese standard.  I liked the playfulness.... 

but back to the important stuff... the Kobe!  Grade A5 from Japan (I'm guessing Vegas had a shipment of this because every place said they had A5 Japanese Kobe!)  Sushi Samba brought out a plate of raw sliced kobe next to a line of dry and wet spices/marinades.  Then came the huge hot rock.  We were then instructed to dip the beef in the marinade of choice, set on rock for 30 seconds a side, then sprinkle with preferred dry spice.  I watched the ladies at our table go first and I saw them immediately go to their "happy place" with the first bite.  After the rest of the table ate, I could see everyone counting the remaining pieces to see how many more bites they had.  Hahahaha!!! So much fun!

Great Sake list if you like that (which I do).  Hundreds of junmai daiginjo bottles going into the $1,000's.  I found a decent one for $50 (300ml).  So recap, get the kobe, enjoy the sushi... don't go if sushi is all that you want, there's better.

Friends from the conference wanted sushi so we went here. Great service from the guy bartender, wish I could remember his name - mixed excellent cocktail, was attentive and when I asked for something new, not too sweet, martini like - he mixed a drink that was one of best martinis I tried. 

Food is good, had some chicken skewers and beef wagyu - nice and flavorful. Might go back for a full dinner before I have to leave for Texas.

If you want to be Interrupted every 3min that's the place to be 
Hostess acknowledge you when you come up to the desk after they are done talking/giggling. Food is overpriced but that's expected since it's on the strip, at least you expect to be greeted the right way before you are forced to sit elbow to elbow next to other guests. Good luck

On my list of must haves anytime we visit Vegas. There hasn't been a single thing that we've ordered that we didn't love.  Great service. Loud, but a fun atmosphere.  Some of our favorites are the rock shrimp tempura, yellow fin taquitos and Sau Paulo sushi roll.

I like this place. I stopped by late on a Saturday night. It was pretty crowded but we we're seated in less than 5 minutes. The DJ did a good job priming up the atmosphere. 
We ordered the Teriyaki Chicken, 3 Meat Entree, with some nigiri on the side. Although, the Teri Chicken and Nigiri portions were small, the 3 Meat Entree made up for it. The steaks couldn't have been cooked any better. The Teri Chicken was average and I've had better sushi. 
The service was on point. Our waitress checked on us numerous times and kept our glasses filled. 
Nice place to grub before a night out.
Great service and my favorite sushi spot. Ate there 2 times during my vegas vacation. Highly recommended.

Great Sushi and Sake Options. Sat at the Sushi bar though and I thought it was a little weird that we didn't order from there but that is non issue to me really. The ambience is ok, a little loud and hard to talk but that might just be the part of the restaur I was sitting in.

Excellent service from Matt who was very knowledgeable of the foreign terms on the menu and made the atmosphere more lively.  He was very patient with the dietary restrictions that my friend had and made great recommendations.  

Highlights were the peruvian corn which were colossal and meaty.  They disappeared very quickly.  We also shared the Rio Grande churrasco.  One of the 3 meats we had chosen were the rib eye which was medium rare and excellent with the red chimichurri dipping sauce (1 of the 4 sauces that came with the dish).  The lobster on the Samba Strip Roll was the best thing of the dish - everything else was a bit plain and for $20, I don't think I'll be ordering that again. We also had the tasty seabass skewers and topped our dinner off with 3 flavors of ice cream on a plate with a chocolate 'Happy Birthday' written on it for the birthday girls. The place is a bit pricey but heck, we were in Vegas!

I've never seen a kids menu available at a Japanese or Asian fusion restaurant. The little boy dining near us was given one of those training chopsticks that are screwed together and all you have to do is pinch...or maybe it was his own...unsure. Haha. 

The ambiance was just lovely. While my fellow diner and I waited for our order, we gazed the room and talked about it for a good 10 minutes. 

The server was very friendly-all smiles- and she described all the dishes we had questions about and gave us great recommendations. We ordered:

seviches and tiraditos (4 assortments for $35, good deal)
      -jumbo shrimp =very fruity, didnt mix with the salty items, but good
      -kanpachi = a very anomalous taste, you'd either hate or love it
      - yellowtail tiradito = yellowtail is alwayys yumm
      - yellowtail seviche = recommended along with ^

we ordered three samba rolls
1) samba strip roll (maine lobster) = good amount of lobster and was yummy.
2) Bobo Brazil (seared kobe beef) = was pretty good
3) Pacific (crab) = mediocre

This place is a little pricey, but you can't get these rolls elsewhere can you? Idk, you try and tell me.

Hello! I am a vegan and I loved this place! Great cocktails but their mushroom toban yaki was fantastic. They had a great eggplant miso skewer which came with Brazilian corn. Fantastic. Would definitely go again!!!!

Very crowded and loud music. Definitely try to make a reservation but great food vegans and non vegans!

How can anyone give this place less than 5 stars??? The place was beautiful super good vibe walking in. Its a nice upscale place. My husband and I went for dinner on the last night of our honeymoon. The waiter was great, very attentive, and the food came out quickly. We had the spicy yellow tail in lemon grass....we ordered two rounds of it. It was so amazing makes my mouth water everytime I think about it. We also had the mango ceviche with banana chips, again AMAZING the fusion of all the different flavors were delicious.  We also got some sort of sashimi don't remember the name, and we also got scallops that were covered in yummy goodness served in sea shells. All in all I would recommend this place as a must go to in Las Vegas for sushi!

this place is overrated in my opinion. i've definitely had better sushi, and i was very disappointed. i had heard about sushi samba for many years, so i was very excited to finally try it out. 

for our appetizer, we ordered the kobe beef dumplings which were very flavorful. for our main dish we ordered three different rolls: bobo brazil, el topo, and carnaval. the carnval was my favorite, but still average, compared to other sushi i've had. the bobo brazil is topped with thin slices of wagyu beef, which i thought i would enjoy, but it was just mostly fat that you couldn't chew through. the carnaval comes with melted mozzarella cheese at the bottom, which i didn't find adding of any value to the taste. the only thing i did like at the restaurant was the non-alcoholic watermelon drink. it was sweet, sour, and refreshing which i loved. 

i didn't care for the ambiance or customer service either; our waitress barely came to our table and the place was too crowded. i'm glad i tried this place out, but i won't be coming back.

Prix fix bachelor party menu. $85 per person.

Probably like 9 course sample appetizer menu in which you get stuffed.

Wagyu cooked on stone.!!! Awesome.

Sea bass skewer is just ridiculously good. Also get 3 rolls along with desert that includes a Peruvian churro?

well worth your money.

This place is a joke, the atmosphere is great but the host checking in is horrible. Waited forever to be checked I. Even though I had called in ahead of time to reserve for 2 people at 8:00pm, I showed up 30mins early and checked in and they still made us wait. I also have seen better sushi rolls in my life, the rolls were disgusting. Not to mention I spend nearly $50 on two cocktails that tasted like juice! Don't go here.

Sea bass screwers soooo yummy!!!!!!  Samba split was very unique and a must try with caramelized bananas, dried pineapples and other goodies.  Best of all server Isabella was very gracious, informative and really enhanced my experience.  In all a wonderful experience.

Easily our new favorite restaurant in Vegas! The service is first class and the food is incredible! A few minutes after being seated we were greeted by the pastry chef and were asked about any food intolerances/allergies and special diets we may have- which is very important to me as I am a vegetarian and have an extreme egg intolerance. We were greeted with a few small dishes at a time that each topped the previous dishes we had! One of my faves was the sea bass- it was exquisite. We had a few different desserts, all of which were incredible and the presentation was impressive. The ambiance was perfect for the evening being lively, colorful, chic and sexy. It was an amazing experience and we are already looking forward to our next Vegas trip JUST to dine here!

Food was very good. 

The noise and the added noise of what they called music ruined the dinner. 

I like to have table conversation.  Not yell at them.

Best sushi in Vegas! A must visit if you like seafood. 
Great ambiance. Cool for a date dinner.
I'v posted on this before. Just can't say enough.  I think this is my favorite restaurant in Vegas.  The dish's are endlessly surprising, and endouringly flavorful.  Everything!!

it was pretty easy for us to make a reservation for 5 of us on a friday night at 8:45pm.  we were late and they still seated us within minutes of us getting there.  the place was crowded.  decor was kinda crazy and colorful.  our waitress was little out of it but it didnt ruin the experience too much.

we ordered a bottle of riesling and they even had the sommelier come and help us a choose a riesling that was less sweet.  but it was still really sweet.  i dont know what the deal was with that.  then we ordered another bottle of beer and she opened another bottle of wine.  

the portions were small.  the sushi rolls seemed tiny to me.  the ceviche sampler was good but the waitress explained them wrong.  scallop and mushroom robata were good too.  miso cod was good.  in general portions were on the small side. i wouldnt actually call their dishes fusion.  their menu was fusion.  with dishes coming from japan, peru, and brazil.  but one dish with the different influences?  not really

the light that was supposed be shining on our table was facing the wrong way so it was super dark.  we counldt see anything.  asked to have it brighter.  waitress forgot.  but then she remembered.  then there was light.
a wonderful restaurant. a must try is the rib eye tobanyaki, the shishito peppers, Peruvian corn, coconut rice and green ice tea. service is great too

Every time I go to Vegas, this is on my to do list.  The BEST cucumber martini's are served here and very addicting.  In a good way.  The atmosphere is awesome, and the food.  The food as AMAZING.  The last time I went to SushiSamba, I had the waiter just pick certain pieces that goes along to create a custom meal, instead of picking an entree from the menu.  The experience was completely out of my hands and everything was extremely tasty.  There was not a single piece of sushi left on the table.  As long as Vegas is open, this is the place to go for Sushi....and cucumber martini's, a MUST on your list. :)
Not a fan. More things were messed up than correct. Perfectly good sushi ruined with overpowering sauces. Just so overdone for the sake of being overdone.

SAO PAULO, SAO PAULO, SAO PAULO!! That roll gave me all the feels in my heart and on my tastebuds. So good!! Sushi is my favorite food, you should see the amount of chopsticks in my kitchen drawer from ordering out. Never have I had a roll where I said, "Wow." I ate one piece and that was the first word out my mouth unintentionally. I also got a yellowtail jalapeño roll which was perfect as well. Nice level of spice and the fish tasted fresh. 

The only disappointment was that the rolls were hoitty toitty, tiny, baby-sized rolls. But I expected that it's Las Vegas and it's "trendy". Guess I'm following the trend..

This was my second time at Sushisamba.  I am not sure this fusion concept is working for me.  Some things executed well while others fell a bit flat.  Priced at the top of the scale I do not think they provide the kind of value I look for at that cost.

Sushi Samba in L.V is a great looking place, with pretty good food.  Not much of a "Peruvian" flavor going on except for the Peruvian corn and Anticuchos.  Our waitress who said she was from Miami seemed to be preoccupied and did not sell us on her recommendations.., she was so preoccupied that it took her a long time to stop by our table again and notice that we were ready to order more of the over priced sushi.

Foodie Orgasms is all i can say about this establishment. I am friends with the Managers at the SouthBeach Location so when i went to go hang out with a friend in Sin City i decided to pull rank and get some First Class service knowing full well i was gonna lose money on the tables. 
Yeah i lost money but wasnt disappointed one bit at the Sushisamba location at the Palazzo Hotel. I will avoid mentioning having to drop a former friend from ruining my dinner right b4 it started but as soon as i got to the location which i must say is unbelievable and by far is the best designed Sushisamba, A close second will be the now defunct location in Dallas at the Galleria mall. I felt like a kid when i entered the restrooms. I had a nice corner to myself and the Hostess was kind enuff to keep me company since i got jilted by a former friend (which i refuse to talk about).  
I got Ala carte type service and even the Chef, Jose came out to greet me and making me feel special cos he remembered me from the Southbeach spot. The taquitos were incredible i had the yellow tail and the lobster one. I decided i was only going to do small plates so i ventured to the Anticuchos and ordered the Chicken liver which just melted in my mouth and made Vegas worthwhile and followed by the Chilean Sea bass that the hostess recommended. For my drink i always get their Caiprinha which is like a Brazilian mojito and was on point.

Now i was getting full but the Chef surprised me with a Kobe Beef plate which was Sushi grade and once again splendid and lest i forget i also ordered the Peruvian corn for my side which is ridiculously tasty. 

There were several groups in town for Bachelors parties and partying in General and the decor just made the groups blend in and make it very private. 

Will definitely be back

My boyfriend took me here for my 24th birthday. 

To start off, the cons of this place was that it was super cramped and nothing was done even though they asked us what we were celebrating.. Kind of lame in my opinion. But onto the food..

My boyfriend ordered an assortment of things and everything I tried was relatively good, some amazing while others were just good. 

We had the crispy taquitos: 1 yellowtail and 1 japanese wagyu. Both were so good and flavorful!! I can't even explain it.. But they were so small.. Like a 2 bite and that's all kind of thing.. And for the price of it, I can't justify it.. Lucky enough for me, it was my birthday and my boyfriend took care of the tab. 

We also had the kanpachi tiradito. This was hands down the best thing all night! I kept thinking about it even after the meal and even to this day. It comes in 4 thin slices  for $19. So expensive, but the truffle oil and the sauce that accompanied it pulled through together so well. 

The sea bass anticuchos was pretty good too.  It was like 4 pieces of fish on each skewer with 2 skewers. The glaze on the fish was good and the fish was cooked perfectly while still having the flakiness.

I also had the uni sashimi, hirami nigiri and yellowtail jalapeño rolls. Those tasted like how they should be.

Because my boyfriend didn't think we would get full, he ordered the rio grande churrasco. The meats were good and flavorful. A bit on the salty side but the greens and rice helped to balance it out. This dish felt somewhat out of place because everything felt so light, but this was definitely too filling and we had to pack the rest to go. 

I would definitely love to come back, but I'm sure it won't be for a long while.

Amazing Asian Fusion in Vegas - yes please!  The sea bass appetizer was hands down the best piece of fish I've ever had. Make sure to get a dish with some Peruvian corn and some sake to top it off.  I'll be back here again next time I'm in Vegas!

A special occasion place: New Years Eve, when you plan on paying quite a bit for a meal in Vegas to enjoy the moment.  The arrangement of the space is fun with a lot of flying strips all over, and a circular path for all the employees to do their occasional dancing.  We had one of the fixed menus along with a few individual items, quite a bit of food, both small and big plates.  The cocktails were unique and tasted great, some very sugary but it was all about indulgence.   Everything was served with flair
Wagyu Gyoza is a must try! Crispy, moist and explosion of flavor. The Ramen was okay. Perfect meal after a long day at the Pool.
Even for a Las Vegas hip joint, over-priced.  Sushi quality only average (in LA, similar quality sushi would be about 1/3 the price).  Nice looking waitresses.

Wish I could give this place a 5 because the food is delicious, but unfortunately because of the lousy service I have to give it 3 stars. Went to this restaurant with a few girlfriends on a trip to Vegas. SUPER Excited to enjoy a great sushi meal with people that LOVE sushi. Instead we were greeted by a server, name to be disclosed, who was degrading, rude, and treated us like cheap girls. 

One of our friends requested for a carafe of hot sake and this server immediately said that this restaurant was too high class to have any sort of hot sake. Who was this guy? How does he not know that we're just girls who enjoy drinking hot sake from time to time-this server needs to learn some MAJOR restaurant etiquette! As the night progressed, the service did not get any better. I've been to MANY wonderful restaurants in Vegas where the food was great and the service EVEN better and this restaurant definitely put the standard of Vegas restaurants in the low range. Fortunately the manager hooked my friends and i with some shots that were delicious - one of them included cucumber and was fresh and cool to the taste. 

On the positive note, the food was ridiculously delicious (hoping there wasn't any extra protein hidden in it). The Sashimi dishes with granny apple sauce and another with some sort of lemon grass sauce was soo good! The Chilean Sea Bass was delectable and probably the best dish on the menu. 

I always believe that Las Vegas has the best places to eat, this restaurant may be one of them, but I will never go there again unless i confirm that this server is not serving my table. And if anyone from this restaurant is reading this...never underestimate your customers!

I literally can never get enough of sushi and this place is great! Ambiance is unique with the Spanish and Brazilian influence and the food is definitely different. 

I got the sea bass dish which was amazing!! The only thing I didn't quite like about it were the veggies that were paired with it (the carrots were so hard and didn't quite go well) but the fish itself was cooked and seasoned to perfection!

We also shared some other stuff like edamame, the tacos (which were quite small and they make you order minimum 2 per order), and some rolls.

WELL DAMNIT I can't remember our servers name but he was freakin' fantastic. Very knowledgeable and attentive! 
Was looking for a great vegan menu so Icky Vicky (vegan) and David (non vegan) and I could all dine out and this looked promising. 
AND IT WAS!! OH MYLANTA IT WAS DELICIOUS!!! 
We pretty much ordered almost everything on the vegan menu - Edamame, Shishito Peppers, Mushroom Tobanyaki, Heirloom Tomato Salad, Amazonia roll, Vegetable sushi, Robata - tomatoes, eggplant, mushrooms and asparagus and Tapioca Con Leche, the fruit plate and sorbet! NOMNOMNOM! SERIOUSLY FREAKIN' NOM! 
And the vegetable sushi actually looked like little nigiri's they were so cute and delicious. Excellent presentation. It was also really nice they have this unique Amazonia roll. They really pulled off an amazing vegan menu and non vegans could of course enjoy this too and I highly recommend trying it!! Do it for the animals! Save the fishies, eat avocado sushi!

Portions are so insanely small. I hardly ever finish a plate and these were tiny even for me. The Chilean Seabass was to die for but after spending a fortune and still feeling starved afterwards I just would not ever return.

This seems like such a tiny thing, but the iced tea is actually an Arnold Palmer with lemonade and mint in it. This wasn't explained to me, and as someone with GERD and a hiatal hernia, foods with high acidity make it so much worse. I only had less than a quarter of the drink, but could still feel the effects. When someone asks for iced tea, you need to tell them that that's not what they're getting. Don't fuck with people's medical conditions.

We were in the mood for sushi and were staying at the Palazzo, so we decided to give this a try.  We were in heaven to say the least!  We started with our drinks and an appetizer.  My husband ordered the Japanese IPA and really liked it, my daughter had the drink special that was excellent and I ordered a glass of Sauvignon Blanc that was great as well. Our appetizer was the Sea Bass Anticuchos..oh my, melt in your mouth tender and the flavor was spectacular!!  We each had a skewer and wanted more!  Then we ordered three different sushi rolls that were also excellent...the Samba Strip was out of this world...best sushi roll all of us have ever had, then we had the Lima which was excellent as well and then the El Topo, which I didn't try because I don't like jalapenos (I know), but my husband and daughter raved about it and it didn't stay on the table for long.  For dessert we ordered the Peruvian Chocolate Ganache and split it...it was so decadent and was the perfect way to end our amazing meal.Our server was very attentive, but exactly when we needed him.  He was very helpful in explaining items on the menu that we had questions about and gave great suggestions as well.  You won't be disappointed coming here to eat, it was excellent!

Fancy sushi place that also serve brazilian asian fusion restaurant. Food tasted really good and sushi rolls are served fresh. Didn't have to wait in line for a table! Excellent service from the wait staff.

My good friend Homer who works here suggested this place, we came from California so we don't know many places in Vegas. Our friend Katie is getting married and we brought in a group of 9 girls .. Immediately upon arriving the hostesses were friendly and ready to seat us .. The manager Jason brought us to our table, introduced himself, and congratulated our friend and got us started with drinks and appetizers .. Shortly after Mike our server came over and got us started with wine and sake .. Appetizers came fast, the food was amazing , and the ambiance was great . We had the best time ! Thank you Homer, Jason & Mike for the hospitality and the best customer service ever. We will definitely be back !

Minus two stars because my husband and I did not think the $60 chef special tasting was special at all. In fact, everything that came out were things that they already have on the menu. If we had known we would have just ordered $120 worth of food and chosen what we wanted to eat. On top of that I told the server I do not eat raw fish and my husband does, so we both expected to see some raw for my hubby and cooked for me, but they brought out everything cooked. It was okay for me, but my husband did not think it was okay. Overall, everything was very tasty, but I felt like it wasn't worth it. The last two rolls they served us was also two different variations of a California roll with a little bit of lobster on top and tempura in the other. My advice would be not to get the tasting menu and opt to order your own dishes. I'm not complaining though. We will be back and maybe after I get to choose my own items I may increase my star rating. I have to say we left feeling fairly full from the meal.

It wasn't the best sushi restaurant but not the worst either. I was really craving Sushi on the day we arrived in Vegas, the weather was amazing as usual, and I just needed something good. We hadn't tried Sushi Samba yet, so we made a reservation and added in that we were celebrating our Wedding anniversary.

I got the spicy Tempura Rock Shrimp, which was good but portion size should have been nearly double what we received, since it cost almost $20 (for an appetizer) I mean it was a lot of lettuce and greens, not much shrimp.

Next we got 2 yellowtail Taquitos and my husband ordered Robata - chicken and Berkshire Pork Belly - and the waiter tried convincing us we needed the filet mignon and duck breast instead - which were "better" - (he actually meant they were more expensive) and we did not want them. Not a fan of duck breast, my husband once again specified Chicken and Pork. The Peruvian Corn that comes with the Robata was outstanding - delicious! That corn may have been the first highlight of our meal.

We ordered a couple of sushi rolls and they were good - just not memorable. I just wanted a "WOW" experience and it never happened.

I am a fan of Japanese Whisky, but I never got any - I ordered some cucumber and gin cocktail instead which did not taste good at all - I regretted it at $15 per drink. They brought out 2 glasses of complimentary champagne for our anniversary, which was more palatable than my cocktail. That was the 2nd highlight of our meal. Overall, we spent $150 on food that was fun and cute, but did not satisfy. But...when in Vegas, I guess. I've eaten better for a quarter of that price. I was full for about an hour, and then started getting hungry again. 

Those Butterfly-shaped gummy candies in the treat box in our room at Encore started to look appetizing...

I gotta say....I wasn't that impressed with this place.  VERY overpriced and had a lot of funky items on their menu (yes, yes, I'm aware that is what fusion is all about) and I didn't really care for the "family-style" presentation of the food. Plus, this restaurant is VERY noisy -- forget about having a private conversation because you'll find yourself yelling across the table at your dinner companion!  The wait staff was very friendly, as was the front hostess.

My friend and I really wanted to grab some decent food (aka not fast food) on our visit to Vegas. We decided on this place and my friend made the dinner reservation. When we arrived, it didn't look like reservations were really needed as there were a good amount of empty tables during Saturday dinner time.

My friend and I sat at the sushi bar. It was odd because whenever I've sat at the bar, the sushi chefs would make conversation or at least greet us. None of them did. My friend ordered a 15 piece omakase (about $52 if I remember correctly). She thought it was just okay, but definitely not worth the price tag. I ordered a miso soup and the São Paulo roll. Okay $6 for a miso soup? Really? I mean I understand it's Vegas, but it literally tasted like a normal miso soup. The São Paulo roll was recommended as one of their most popular rolls. The first thing I noticed when it came out was how minuscule the fish portion was. Some pieces didn't even have a full layer of fish across the top. I wish I would've taken a picture to display what it looked like. For $24, I just expected a bit more. 

The service was so odd here. The hostess that was at the front when we checked in was not friendly. There were a few servers crowding around the end of the sushi bar where we sat. They were chatting it up amongst each other, which I thought made for a little unpleasant dining experience. Overall, I was pretty underwhelmed by this restaurant.

So we came here with another couple to celebrate an occasion. 
It was my first time here . Everyone said it's amazing place . So the first round was amazing . Everything is so good here. Service is great . We got Philip to serve us and he did an amazing job. The food was amazing I would recommend everyone to come here .
The sushi was overpriced and not tasty, but the Chilean Sea Bass was wonderful.

Three words OH MY GODDDD!!!! We are in love love with this spot. All our Vegas trips include a stopover to Sushi Samba and they are worth every penny and minute.
Friends who were introduced to this venue have also turned into ardent fans and frequent visitors.
Highly recommend asking your server for tips- they are awesome!

I was visiting Las Vegas for a birthday bash and my first night in town we hit Sushi Samba. Coming from Hawaii with such fresh fish available, I am always a little skeptical about sushi places on the mainland, but I was exceedingly surprised and my taste buds did a happy dance with everything that I had to eat that night. The staff was extremely friendly, attentive and helpful with answering questions about the menu and offering suggestions on food and beverages. 

All in all it was a great evening with great food and wonderful service. I would definitely recommend this venue to friends who either live in or visit Las Vegas.

LOVE this place. I thought maybe I loved it so much the first time because I was so hungry. Not the case. Came a second time and let the server choose. So good! We thought we were coming for sushi, but we also had the yellow fish tacos, some beef pot stickers, and the sea bass and was not disappointed. I'll be returning when I come back to town.

Now, when I heard that this was a Brazilian/ Sushi fusion, I'll admit I was a bit hesitant. But boy was I wrong--so very, very wrong. 

A little on the pricier side, treat yourself Lad Vegas style to some fresh rolls, a lively atmosphere, and flavorful Brazilian meats. 

We ordered a variety of things off the menu (hey, we had to try it all), and not one failed to amaze my tastebuds. The service was impeccable, with the manager insisting we try additional dishes that we didn't order because he was convinced we would leave in a food coma. So far, that's SushiSamba-2: Jennifer-0. 

Ladies, just be forewarned. The stalls in the restroom are itty bitty, awkwardly shaped and oddly adorned with a mirror and dimmed lighting. If you can hold it...hold it. Just please, trust me. 

SushiSamba, I shall return for a rematch, one for which I can almost guarantee you will win again.

Service was great. 4-5 different staff came to our table through our dinner (bring food, clear plates, drinks, wipe table, etc). The food was delicious and high quality. Atmosphere was nice. Casual elegance. We will return

My colleague and I made reservations at this restaurant while traveling for work. The restaurant is super dark, even the bathroom. However, the ambiance is lovely.

I alerted my waitress immediately that I am vegan and gluten-free. She brought me out a special vegan menu and told me the items that are available gluten-free. I got the edamame appetizer and for my entree, the Amazonian roll and individual veggie rolls special. Brown rice was not available as a substitute for the sushi rice, which I prefer. However, I was able to get over it once my sushi came out. Both my colleague and I agreed it was the best sushi we had ever eaten. I ordered another Amazonian roll and devoured that, too.

Although it is pricey, this restaurant is a must 5/5.
1. For a non-veg restaurant, there are tons of veg options available. 
2. I also loved how so many things could be made gluten-free.
3. Service was attentive I wish I could go every week. 
4. Fanciest, most delicious vegan sushi ever.
